snippet: The recommendations on 45 common procedures, likely to alter standards of hospital care, represent an acknowledgment by doctors that many profitable treatments are performed unnecessarily.
abstract: Medical specialty boards plan to recommend that doctors perform 45 common tests and procedures less often, and to urge patients to question these services if they are offered; recommendations represent frank acknowledgment by doctors that many profitable treatments are performed unnecessarily but change of heart also reflects changes in the health care marketplace.
lead_paragraph: The recommendations on 45 common procedures, likely to alter standards of hospital care, represent an acknowledgment by doctors that many profitable treatments are performed unnecessarily.

headline.seo: Doctor Panels Urge Fewer Routine Tests
headline.main: Doctor Panels Recommend Fewer Tests for Patients
headline.print_headline: Doctor Panels Recommend Fewer Tests For Patients
